  • Constructor Details

    • VideoBoxView

      public VideoBoxView​(VideoBox controller, boolean needListener)
      This creates the view of the videoBox. It will contains the actual VideoPanel, the controls button, the info button, the slider and the interaction panel.
      Parameters:
      controller - the controller of the Component
      needListener - a boolean to know if the controller must be added as a listener or not

  • Method Details

    • setupSouthPanel

      private void setupSouthPanel()
      This method sets up the south panel, that is the panel with all the controls of the video, the slider, the info button and the interactions panel.

    • setupControllButtonsPanel

      private void setupControllButtonsPanel()

    • setupPlayButton

      private void setupPlayButton()
      Sets the playButton aspect, adding the actionListener to is, adding it to controllButtonsPanel.

    • setupTimeline

      private void setupTimeline()
      Takes the mediaPlayer of the videoBox in order to obtain the video duration, and the width of the videoSurface. This will be necessary to set the slider to the proper dimension and to link it to the actual timeline of the video.

    • setupInfoButton

      private void setupInfoButton()
      This method sets up the infoButton. The infoButton will create a new DialogBox shown to the user as a JDialog in order to display some info related to the video itself.

    • setupInteractionPanel

      private void setupInteractionPanel()
      This method creates the panel with all the interaction. After the creation, it'll dispatch an InteractionPanelCreatedEvent to the above listeners.

    • dispatchInteractionPanelCreated

      private void dispatchInteractionPanelCreated()
      Dispatch to the above listener an InteractionPanelCreatedEvent in order to notify them about the copmletion of the creation of the interaction panel.

    • setupVideoTitle

      private void setupVideoTitle()
      This method takes the VideoTitle from the database and display it on top of the videoSurface.

    • setupVideoSurface

      private void setupVideoSurface()
      Creates the videoSurfacePanel that will show the video. It will also add some videoListeners to the video.

    • setupVideoListeners

      private void setupVideoListeners()
      This method set the single click on the videoSurface as a Mouse listener that will toggle the playPauseButton.

    • togglePausePlayButton

      private void togglePausePlayButton()
      This method ask the mediaPLayerComponent to pause or play the video depending on its current status. The current status is updated accordingly. It also re-arrange the view in order to be consistent with the status of the video: the pause button is turned into a play button and viceversa.

    • setupMainPanel

      private void setupMainPanel()
      This method setup the mainPanel of the videoBox, that is the panel that contains the actual videoPanel TODO forse no, vedi bene

    • freezeVideo

      public void freezeVideo()
      This method will pause the video.

    • restartVideoAfterFreeze

      public void restartVideoAfterFreeze()
      This method will play the video after it's been frozen.

    • getMainPanel

      public javax.swing.JPanel getMainPanel()

    • setupImage

      private void setupImage()
      The main function of the video box. This will build the videoPanel by rendering the video file and extracting from it the array of frames the video is made of. This is not the usual way to embed a videoPlayer in a JAVA application: usually an EmbeddedMediaPlayer from the vlcj library has to be implemented to play video. Since we used a JAVA version later than 1.6 on MacOS there is no heavyweight AWT toolkit that can manage the EmbeddedMediaPlayer. That means that via the vlcj this method will create a video buffer (the bufferedImage file) and then it'll render it on screen. The code this func is taken and inspired from the official tutorial of the caprica vlcj website (https://capricasoftware.co.uk/projects/vlcj-3/tutorials/direct-rendering)

    • dismissVideo

      public void dismissVideo()
      This method will release the video detaching it from the mediaPLayerComponent.

    • getSlider

      public javax.swing.JSlider getSlider()

    • getVideoSurface

      public javax.swing.JPanel getVideoSurface()

      public javax.swing.JPanel getControlButtonsPanel()
